text: Bottle of the 2009 at Kulminator. Deep brown with a nice tan head. Aroma is sour prunes, dates, caramel, anise. Medium-full bodied, sweet and sour on the palate with a long complex, slightly sour finish. Taste is sour plums, dates, prunes, sour cherries.

Dark brown colored, clear, small beige frothy head, not too lasting. Aroma is of some malt, caramel, and light toast, bit chocolate, mostly dark fruits, medium tart fruit, vinous, woody. Medium sweet malt, some caramel, bit toffee, light chocolate, lots of dark fruits, moderate+ tartness and acetic, dryish finish, some alcohol and bit of warmth, some wood, vinous. Medium+ bodied, soft- carbonation, oily.
(bottle, Bierhalle Deconinck, Vichte)

33 cl bottle as "Aardnon 2009". Bottled on 18.02.2017.
Rated on 20170520.
Pours dark red-brown color with a small head. Aroma has ripe fruits and caramel, sourish berry notes and wood. Flavor is sourish ripe fruity with malts and earthy tones, and even some spices. Complex and demanding brew.
4434

330 ml bottle. 2009 version. Pours a dark brown colour without a head. Aroma of balsamic vinegar, red berries, some graininess and raisins. Flavour of red berries, vinegar, syrupy sweetness, vanilla and wood. Medium bodied. Dry and acidic finish. Aardmonnik is better.

33 cl bottle @¬†olio, bottled 18.02.2016
¬îAARDNON 2009¬î on the rather simplistic label. Lot NÀöBA00018022009
Aroma has vinegar, chlorine and moldy cellar. Also mild syrupy tones. Flavour is somewhat acidic with moldy cellar, balsamico, vinegar and grapefruity tones. The mold unfortunately ruins the show here. Quite a disappointment.

330ml bottle from Beergium (as Aardnon 2009 Cask Strength Blend in Barrel Limited Edition Medium Carbonation - Barrel 7 Years, bottled 18/02/2016). Pours dark brown with a small white head. Aroma of plums, wood, raisins, oak, vanilla and earthiness. Taste is sourish, smooth and woody with loads of plums, raisins, vanilla, earthiness, tart cherries and farmyard. Finish is stingy, funky, sour and tartish with some plums, raisins, ripe fruits, cherries, oak, wood, toffee and earthiness. Complex, quite difficult beer.

Bottle. Aroma is sweet. Caramel, vanilla, almonds, figs, dark fruits. Also some honey. Taste is a big suprisy. Aroma suggested that beer will be sweet. But no, beer is slightly sour. There are cherries, red fruits, a little bit tart. After that there is some dark notes like cocoa. Beer is rich in taste and very, very complex.

Aardnon jest blendem 30% Aardmonnik i 70% Pannepot Reserva (le≈ºakowane w dƒôbowych beczkach Ch√¢teau Margaux).
Piwo le≈ºakowa≈Ço 7 lat w beczkach.   
 Data butelkowania:  18.02.2016 
 Data wa≈ºno≈õci:  27.02.2021 
 Kolor:  CiemnobrƒÖzowe, nieprzejrzyste. PoczƒÖtkowo wydaje siƒô czarne. 
 Piana:  Jak na ten styl piana wydaje siƒô ob≈Çƒôdna. Ma ciemno kremowy kolor, zbitƒÖ i zwartƒÖ konsystencjƒô. 
Sprawia wra≈ºenie jednej, jednolitej masy.
Opada w d√≥≈Ç powolutku. Pozostawia szereg wstƒôg na ≈õciankach Sniftera. 
 Zapach:  Aromat jest po prostu kosmiczny. Pierwsze przes≈Çanki sƒÖ kompletnie zaskakujƒÖce. Piwo jest wpisane w styl Sour Ale, a pachnie intensywnƒÖ wanilia, karmelem, toffi. Pod spodem odrobina miodu.
Daleko w tle cierpkie, owocowe nuty. Co≈õ jakby rabarbar posypywany cukrem.
Dla mnie bomba! 
 Smak: W smaku na maksa odjechane. Nie wiem czy jestem w stanie wyobraziƒá sobie jakiekolwiek piwo w podobnym stylu. 
Jest to mieszanka wielu styl√≥w i ≈õwiat√≥w.
Piwo na pierwszy rzut oka wydaje siƒô s≈Çodkie, karmelowe z elementami ciemnych i czerwonych owoc√≥w (rabarbar, ≈õliwka, wi≈õnie). Po prostu mix doskona≈Çy.
Po chwili staje siƒô intensywnie kwa≈õne, owocowe z dominantami w postaci cierpkich owoc√≥w (czerwone i ciemne winogrona). 
Piwo ma gƒôstƒÖ teksturƒô, umiarkowane wysycenie.
Odczucie w ustach jest pe≈Çne.
Piwo rozp≈Çywa siƒô dos≈Çownie na podniebieniu.
Niesamowite doznanie! 
 Wysycenie:  ≈örednie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Teraz ju≈º wiem dlaczego ma≈Ça butelka tego piwa kosztuje ponad 60 z≈Ç., a na rynku wt√≥rnym ok. 100 ;)
Piwo jest po prostu odjechane w kosmos.

Dawno ju≈º nie pi≈Çem takiego ewenementu.
Trunek w aromacie nie daje ≈ºadnych przes≈Çanek, ≈ºe mo≈ºe to byƒá kwa≈õne piwo.
Wprost przeciwnie jest mega s≈Çodkie, owocowe, karmelowe, a potem waniliowe.
Dopiero w smaku pokazuje swoje kwa≈õne oblicze, prze≈Çamane wyra≈∫nƒÖ s≈ÇodyczƒÖ. 
Kompleksowe, doskonale beczkowa, nietuzinkowe piwo.

Bottled. 15cl sample. Thanks Caesar for sharing. The aroma has red fruit, bit tartness. Hazy, red-brown coloured beer with a thin, off-white head. The taste is light-moderate sour, has red fruit, vinegar and tartness. Medium bodied beer. Bit boring.

Bottle shared by Matteo & Wingmane at Leighton¬ís 20K. It pours hazy dark red - brown with a small tan head. The aroma is rich, juicy, tangy, jammy fruits, victoria sponge, vanilla, cranberry, redcurrant and Dr Pepper. The taste is rich, bitter - sweet, tangy, sweet - sour, sugary, rich red fruits, vanilla, wood, vinous, victoria sponge cake and balsamic vinegar with a juicy and tangy finish. Medium+ body and fine carbonation. Juicy, tangy and rather fruity. Tasty stuff.
Drank 28-3 @Majid the night before going to Struise (2009 vintage). Very ¬ícontained sour¬í, with soft carbonation and mild sweetness. Intensely complex. Very good.

Bottle courtesy of Linus. Cask strength 2009 version. Murky deep reddish brown pour with a thin beige head. Soft malts, caramel, lemon & dark dried fruits. Vanilla, oatmeal & light balsamic. Sour, tiny bitter & malty taste. Round & tart mouthfeel. Pleasant oxidation but falls a bit short in the taste where the round aromatics of the nose doesn¬ít come through.

Aroma: zuurtje, donker fruit, hout en alcohol.

Smaak: kersen, donker fruit, zuurtje, azijn, hout en wat gist.

Heerlijk!
Bottle as Aardnon/Earthnun 2009. Lots of cherries with nice vanilla, some wood present too. Medium body, surprisingly just lightly sour. Really nice.

April 1, 2017. Bottle, 2016 bottling. 
Dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is fruity, metallic with prunes, tart cherries, lemon, vingar, wood, 
Taste is sour, slight sweetness. Medium bodied, average carbonation, dry texture. Finish is sour, fruity, metallic, cherries, prunes, light m√•let notes. 
Tio much metallic notes.
2009, 7y BA A: Deep purple colour with a thin offwhite lacing N: Blackberry, red plum, hint of raisins T: Cherry, plum, aluminum O: Sweet and overaged. Nah..

2009 cask strength bottle, dark chesnut colour. Nose of big earthy leather caramel from the pannepot reserva, cherries, leather, metallic notes, vineous Porto notes, blue cheese, nothing like a cask strength. Back blended again? Just like all of their regular beers. It¬ís like all of their new beers.

F: thin, tan, quick diminishing to thin film.
C: dark, opaque.
A: malt, chocolate, vinous, red fruits, nutty, woody, caramel, hint of cocoa, plums, hint of coffee, complex.
T: malt, red vine, woody, red fruits, plums, figs, caramel, chocolate, sweet and acidic tones nicely balanced, medium to full complex body, lower carbonation, light oily mouthfeel, really nice for this style worth to try, vintage 2009, bottled on 18/02/2016, 33cl bottle from De Struise brewery

Bottle. Pours an opaque murky dark brown with a fading beige bubbly head. Aroma is of vinegar, red fruits, caramel, tart, hint of soy sauce, earthy. Taste is of balsamic vinegar, dark fruits, figs, nuts, tart, red fruits, berries, caramel. Oily mouthfeel, soft to medium carbonation.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2017 Bottle at home, 2009 ed, bottled 18/02/16. Pours a beautiful ruby, very dark brown colour topped by a slim but stable, creamy beige head. Flemish sour/Aardmonnik notes immediately fill the nostrils, with notes of cherry, red wine, balsamico. Taste is more on the Pannepot side of things with quad dried (figs, plums) fruits and berries, red wine/barrel, roasted malty caramel and espresso, then a nuanced cherry sour note kicks in to round the finish of fruity and a little bit funky. Incredible balance. Lingering cherry fruity, quad malty aftertaste. Firm body, low carbonation. Liked the Aardmonnik better but an incredible beer.

March 1st 2017Leighton¬ís 20K at his posh new gaff! Thanks to Dave and Matteo. Hazy deep amber beer, small pale tan head. Palate is airy and has modest fine carbonation. Mild vinegar and tangy fruits. A little malt sweetness provides some relief. Bare whisper of vanilla. Bitterish finish. Not digging the vinegar here.

St David¬ís Day 2017 - Bottle share at Leighton¬ís 20K. Many congrats! As ¬íStruise Aardnon / Earthnun 2009 Cask Strength¬í. Big thanks to team Matteo-Dave. Dark brown, pretty much opaque in this light, foamy light brown head leaves dotted lacing. Aroma is fruit n nut chocolate, plummy, raisin. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is rum n raisin, plum, spicy and woody in the finish, light acidity, some of the apple esters I¬íve got from other Struise beers but not so prevalent. Nice. (3.9)

(Struise Aardnon / Earthnun) Bottle 330ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 8%, vintage 2009
Black coloured body, small beige head on top with good density and retention.
Aroma of dark fruits, figs, molasses, light red fruits too.
Taste is mildly sour, with red fruits, berries, dark fruits too, light caramel, wine notes.
Medium body, good carbonation, slightly tart on the palate.
Quite good but taking the price into account, I expected much more.
Great beer, a lot of dried fruits in aroma and taste. Some sourness, very much like quadrupel. Great beer

Bottle 330ml. [ As Struise Aardnon / Earthnun ].[ Vintage 2009 ]. Clear dark brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, beige head. Aroma is moderate malty, dark malt, oxidide, moderate yeasty, belgioum yeast, tobacco, wood, dark fruit - dried fruit - tart fruit. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light acidic with a long duration, bread, tart, tobacco, wood, dark fruit - dried fruit - tart fruit. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20161230]
 7-3-8-4-16

Bottle at home. Pours clear tawny with a medium, frothy beige head, medium retention with light lacing. Aroma is moderate acetic cherries and plums with bready and toast malt and light, earthy stale hops. Flavor is acetic cherries and plums, bready and toasty malt, light spices and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Bottle thanks to beerandblues2. Pours dark brown. Aroma is dark fruit, caramel, woody notes, faint chocolate, and soft acidity. Flavor is rich dark fruit, big tannins, leather, oak, soft acidity, and very faint milk chocolate. Medium body.
Train beer post ACBF. Brown color, small tan head. Vinous fruity aroma. Big soft sour dark fruit and roast taste. Delicious.
33cl bottle. Fast klare orange braune Farbe, geringe beige schaumkrone. Geruch ist holzig, karamellig, rote Fr√ºchte. Geschmack ist fruchtig, rotes malz, rote Fr√ºchte, holzig, minimal s√§uerlich.

330ml 2009 thanks to Jen and Joe T for this one. Pours out brown amber topped with a sand head. Nose is pit fruit cherries sour notes barrel. Taste is more of the nice pit fruit rich malts and cherries barrel.

66cl bottle shared at Leighton¬ís Penthouse for his 20K. Sourced via Etre. It pours a clean dark brown color with some ruby edges and a minimal beige head. Aroma is sweet and boosty with notes of caramel cocoa and melon. Taste is sweet and medium tangy acidic with notes of vinegar, red wine, balsamic vinegar. Medium bodied with ok carbonation. Overall, quite nice this one

Bottle shared at the Leighton mega 20k tasting. 1/03/2017. Many thanks to Wingman and Matteo for this one. A clear nutty brown coloured pour with a ruby red by hues, halo of off white head. Aroma is harsh solvent alcohol, apple brandy, swet nutty malts, . Flavour is composed of tart granny Smith apple, tart fruit, nutty malts, raisin fruits, cakey. Palate is tart fruit, apple, semi sweet, moderate carbonation, woody dry finish.

Bottle shared in London for the 20k - thanks! Pours lightly unclear amber with minimal head. Dry and leathery fruits in the nose, some toffee, light funk. Medium sweet flavour with good tart berries, acetic burn, leather, brown sugar. Medium bodied with delicate carbonation. Tart and acetic in the finish, more leathery berries, hints of caramel, brown bread, cherry, salt. Classic stuff.

Flaska fr√•n Beergium. M√∂rk, murken r√∂dbrun med lite smutsbeiget skum. Djup vin√∂s doft, som att sticka n√§san i ett glas med r√∂dvin. B√§riga toner, kola, torkad frukt, russin, kandisocker, tydliga ekfatstoner, en sn√§ll syrlighet och en subtil kaffeton n√•gonstans i bakgrunden. Mellanstor kropp med str√§va fatinslag. Smaken √§r b√•de komplex, djup och r√§ttfram. M√§ngder av r√∂dvin, b√§rig s√∂tma som bryter av mot str√§va och torr syrlighet. Ruskigt v√§lbalanserat och v√§lkomponerat. Inlagda, syrliga k√∂rsb√§r, kola och en l√§tt br√§nd avslutning. Fantastiskt djup och fyllig. S√• n√§ra ett glas r√∂dvin en √∂l kan komma. Imponerande!

Aromat jest cudowny, bardzo winny ale te≈º przebija siƒô karmel, suszone wi≈õnie, dƒôbina. 
Smak lekko kwa≈õny, lekko s≈Çodki, spora taniczno≈õƒá ale na akceptowalnym poziomie. W smaku ogrom wi≈õni, takich w likierze, karmelu i czekoladzie. Bardzo du≈ºo drewna, lekka palono≈õƒá. Posmak bardzo winny, w typie ciƒô≈ºszych win czerwonych, lekko cierpki, d≈Çugi i przyjemny. Cia≈Ço dosyƒá pe≈Çne, faktura nawet g≈Çadka, wysycenie niskie. 
Og√≥lnie jest to ≈õwietne piwo, taki siper dobry do wieczora i filmu/serialu. Jest fajnie z≈Ço≈ºone, a ten posmak zostaje na tyle d≈Çugo i jest tak przyjemny, ≈ºe po≈Çowƒô ma≈Çej butelki mo≈ºna piƒá godzinƒô. No i w og√≥le szale≈Ñstwo browaru De Struise, zrobiƒá piwo w 2009 i trzymaƒá w beczce przez 7 lat :D

Bottle. Pours a dark amber brown color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty woody sour vinous aroma. Fruity sour tart vinous dark fruit raisin flavor. Has a fruity sour woody dark fruit and raisin finish.

[1/27/17] Bottle/Can/Crowler/Growler at a bottle share at Flamingo Hotel in Santa Rosa. 2009 bottle. Dark brown with a tan head. Oxidation, red and dark fruits, cellar, funk. Rounded mouthfeel. Great. Can¬ít believe I got to try this.

Beeroda.hu Beer Tasting Sessions @ Budapest //
Hazy dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dark malts, dried fruit, wood and tart fruit. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish.

0,33l bottle at home courtesy of Saeglopur, big thanks for this one. Bottled 18/02/2016. BB 17.02.2021. dark brown color, small tan head. smells oxidation, some light sour notes, dark fruits, raisins, nutty, light cherry notes. bit weird smell, not very convincing. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes lightly sour, oxidation, some berry notes, light vinegar, some dark fruits, some brown sugar, bit nutty. finishes lightly sour and dry with notes of berry notes, sour and earthy notes. Ok, but quite messy, not a big fan.

Bottle from Hopt.nl, shared with Benzai and skortila. Bottle date 18/02/16 BB 17/02/21,10 cl sample. Hazy redbrown color, short frothy head. Aroma of caramelly malt, tart and lactic acid, but also some plastic and balsamic vinegar. Lactic and balsamic in taste, together with sweet caramel. Lacks complexity and balance. Not at all impressed and the price was typically Struise as well.

Bottle from Etre, 2009 cask strength. Dark reddish brown with small, off white head. Aroma of chocolate, a bit of acetone, red berries, light spice and cherries. Taste is similar, getting more and more tart and vinous as it warms. Tart dark fruit finish. Complex and interesting, but I¬íd actually like it even more sour than it is.

2009 Vintage. Pours a muddy umber color with a trace of bubbles. Nose has lots of fruity pebbles qualities with underlying cocoa, cola nut and warming spices. palate follows with a nice balance of tart fruity layers and soft cola undertones with nuances of tootsie roll, vinous tannins, nutmeg, vanilla. Nice complexity throughout.

Bottle shared by Caesar. 7 year aged apparently? Well...I¬ím curious. Dark red-brown color, small off-white to beige head. Aroma is -even though officially it¬ís impossible- a bit sweetish and a bit weird. Flavor is a bit sourish, a bit sweetish, sour fruit, tart, red fruit in the background. Decent beer, not my style, but ok. Definitely solid for a sour red-brown.

33cl-fles van bij ¬ít Oud Schooltje te Vleteren. U: Zwart met een kleine bruine schuimkring. G: Koffie, vanille, balsamico en rood fruit. S: Zoetzuur met wat moutbitterheid. Koffie, pure chocolade, vanille, rood fruit en brett. M: Volmondig, licht sticky met weinig carbonatie.

Bottle pour at the RateBeer Best 2017 Grand Tasting/Bottle Share. 2009 vintage, Cask Strength Blend. Dark brown with beige head. Aromas of acetone, dark fruit, raisins. Tastes of tart dark fruit, vinegar. Medium-light body with a dry finish.

330ml bottle. Pours dark brown. No head. Acidic notes, berries, hints of caramel in the aroma. Notes of berries, acididness at first. Rowanberries, bitterness in the middle. Notes of red wine. Dry, acidic finish. Rowanberries and tannins in the aftertaste. Rather medium bodied, low carbonated, very complex and good brew.

Huge thanks to Randall for sharing this bottled rarity. Nose is very earthy and a touch acidic. Vinous with dried fruit accents. Flavor is a really beautifully blended mix of the qualities of earth monk and panepot reserva. Full bodied with a long tangy finish and nice vanilla and dried fruit accents. Decadent but delicious.

330 mL bottle. Aardnon 2009, Cask Strength Blend in Barrel Limited Edition. 7 years? Some punctuation would be great. Pours murky brown with almost no head. Smells of figs, oak, brown sugar, some cherry, wine. Tastes of oxidation, oak, red wine. Light acidity that gradually builds into a dry, vinous finish. Has some caramelized sugars that never really come off as sweet. This took a bit for me to come around to, but in the end I¬ím really enjoying it.

Bottle ¬í09, generously shared bun randall. Murky brown pour with a kaki head. Sour vinous aromas. Delicious with sour cherry, huge vinous, vinegar, caramel malts, and oak. Vanilla lowlights. Complex with a wonderful mouthfeel. Good body.
Bottle thanks to Jen T! Pours a very dark brown with small beige head that lasts. The aroma is dark fruit, leather, wood. Medium body, dark fruit, wood, leather, vinegar, light tartness, very good.

Bottle. Dark amber with dirty-white/tan head. Like it very much - slightly vinegar just like it should be, carmelish, moderately sour, wood, some raisins, fruity and dry. Finish is dry, fruity, sour and vinous. In general: this is it.
Znakomite. S≈Çodki aromat - Porto, rodzynki, karmel. W smaku zaskoczenie, do≈õƒá wytrawne, choƒá sporo cia≈Ça, kwa≈õne, lekko octowe. Mega.
W aromacie mega s≈Çodko - figi, suszone owoce, toffi. W smaku otrzymujemy zupe≈Çnie co innego - przyjemnie kwa≈õne, nuty octu balsamicznego, taniny. Super piwo!

UPDATED: APR 19, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking an Aardnon / Earthnun (2009) by De Struise Brouwers at Chmielarnia Marsza≈ÇkowskaAromat figi rodzynki toffi ciemne owoce slodko bardzo. W smaku jak flanders... niemalo ciala. Niemalo tanin. CzadOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).Rami Rami is drinking an Aardnon / Earthnun (2009) by De Struise Brouwers at Czerniakowska

Duzo gorsza, mniej intensywna butelka niz pamietam. Jakies figi, cos, w uscie i slodkawe i kwaskowate, ale generalnie jednak troszke nijakie w stosunku do poprzedniego piciaocena ciut w dol w ramach usrednienia

Appearance: dark brown, clear, tan foam, rocky head, small quantity. Aroma: berries, bread, toasty. Taste:heavily sour, medium sweetness, medium bitterness. Berries in taste: cranberry, chokeberry. average carbonation, bitter, abrupt finish, medium almost full body,oily feel,

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2017 Bottle. Pours dark brown with small beige head. Aroma: sourish, balsamico, berries,vine, berries, chocolate, weak coffee. Taste: medium sour, chocolate, balsamico, chokeberry, cranberry, spicy, Medium body. Really nice and different beer.
brown liquid without head. aroma of caramel, aspirin. taste is light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium+ sourness. medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,

Bottle. Pours deep drown with a small brown head which recedes quickly. Aroma is raisins, cocoa, vanilla, caramel. Taste is tart dark berries, citrus brett, raisins, red wine, caramel sweet, slight vinegar.

Bottle. A dark amber beer with a tan head. The aroma has notes of caramel, malt, alcohol, roasted malt, and a bit of brett. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, caramel, alcohol, brett, fruit, and wood, leading to a dry finish.

2009 bottle. Deep dark brown color. Caramel, a hint of roast and malt syrup in the vinous aroma. Malty sweet, moderately sour, vinous flavor. Red wine, remains of roast and licorice. Amazing complexity. Low on carbon. Worth the sky-high price tag.

Sample from 33 cl bottle. Near black with a thin, tanned head. Tart, fruity aroma with rich dark fruits, wooden notes, soft. Taste is sour. Medium bodied. Lasting dry, fruity finish with red Wine barrel and vineuos notes. World class.
33 cl. bottle. Hazy brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of yeast, tartness, oak, red wine and alcohol.

[email¬†protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ - Dark brown nearly black with a beige head. Aroma and taste is medium sour fruity, some dark berry fruits, light vinegar, some dark malty character, red wine soaked wooden barrel notes into the close.

33 cl bottle. Pours dark amber with a small tan head. Aroma is overripe fruity and caramelish malty. Dry malty, sourish, milky. Caramelish. Toasted malty. Sweet and toasted, sourish. Dry and fruity, sour and wineous finish. Toasted malty finish.
Bottle. Aroma of roasty, caramel, overriped fruits, berries, citrus and lactic. Complex. Starts light sweet and turns tart sour. Medium body and juicy texture. A good one...
Bottle. It pours very dark brown with a creamy beige head. The aroma is spicy and ripe fruity sweet malty notes. The flavor is bourbon, vanilla, ripe berries and light acid.

Bottle, vintage 2009 @ Johns. Pours very dark brown with a small light brown head, light lacings. Aroma of light sourness, light sweet malt, caramel, oak, dried fruit, redwine. Flavor is rather sour, light sweet, malt, light vinegar, little caramel, dried fruit, little vinegar, tart oaky, grapes. Medium body, soft carbonation, light acidic finish. 301216

Bottle "2009", 8%. Clear dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, toasted, dark fruit, oak and wood. Flavour is malt, caramel, toasted, little sour fruit, dark fruit, oak, wood, little citric, little dry, little earthy and a little sour.

Bottle @ Saxo tasting. Vintage 2009. Hazy dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dark malts, dried fruit, wood and tart fruit. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 301216

Bottle Vintage 2009. Frothy off-white good mostly dminishing head. Dark erd amber colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter nice sour flavor. Long light bitter nice sour finish. Exstremely syruply palate. Great but not outstanding.
Bottle 2009 @ Aarhus tasting, my place. Medium head with medium duration. Color is dark brown. Aroma and taste are sour malt, fruits, cheese, caramel and hops. Lightly oxidated.

Bottle. Pours cloudy brown. Aroma of butterscotch, red berries, slight vinegar, brown sugary, slight herbal, loads of dried fruits and slight oak, light tannis. Taste is rather sweet with loads of sour berries, dried fruits and oak.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2016 New year tasting at Thomas. Brown with a small off-white head. Aroma of caramel, molasses and butterscotch with a funky note. Sweet, fruity flavour with raisin and caramel. A tart note in the finish

Piana niska, drobna, szybko opada do firanki. Barwa ciemno rubinowa, nieprzejrzysta. Aromat intensywny i z≈Ço≈ºony - jest czerwone wino, jest porto, jest malaga, sƒÖ wi≈õnie w czekoladzie, karmel, suszone owoce, ciemne winogrona, w tle wanilia i marcepan... Klasa! W smaku zar√≥wno winna kwa≈õno≈õƒá jak i quadruplowa s≈Çodycz, kandyzowane owoce mieszajƒÖ siƒô z porzeczkami, taniny i wanilia z cierpko≈õciƒÖ pestek, karmel przenika z taninami i tytoniem... Taki blend to faktycznie mistrzostwo ≈õwiata - zaspokoi zar√≥wno quado head√≥w jak i sour head√≥w!

Bottle, 2009 vintage, bottled 18/02/16 (from etre gourmet). Pours dark brown with light brownish head. Aroma is sour, vinegar, fruits, cherries, malt, roast, some candy. Flavor is sour, sweet, dark fruits, malt, cherries, oak, oxidized notes, caramel. Finish is sour and bitter. Alocohol is well covered. Overall: great brew, very nice blanace between sourness and sweetness. I suspect I would have liked fresher sample even more, but this is still damn nice...bumped the overall, but still feels like underrate.

330 ml bottle from Etre Gourmet, bottled 18/02/16, bb 17/02/21.
Dark copper-brownish body, with a small, fizzy, dissipating, beige head.
Aroma of overripe fruits, leather, cocoa, brown sugar, oak, red wine, vinegar.
Tastes quite similar, but with more fruits, like cherries, grapes, wild berries.
Medium, a bit oily mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes medium acidic, a bit sweet, vinous, wooden, fruity, alcohol warming, a bit astringent.

Tasty. Complex and characterful, with diverse notes from the wine barrel, but also dark malts and lovely fruit notes throughout. Greatly balanced, with the right levels of acidity and sweetness, alcohol just provides a pleasant warmth. Really enjoyable overall, while not among my favourite style examples.

Bottle from etregourmet. Dark brown colour, thin layer of foam. Nose of red berries, balsamic vinegar, sweet malts, vanilla. Very fruity and tart, well blended with sweet notes of Pannepot Reserva. Nice experiment.

hazy brown colour with ruby notes, minimal yellowish beige head; aroma of dried black cherry, woody-port wine notes, bitter marzipan, tannines, grape, burnt sugar maybe hints of anise, too; taste is the same with mild vinegar notes; excellent beer!

Bottle shared with and courtesy of an on-heat platypus on an Artic Den Haag winter¬ís eve. Very dark brown with a ring tan head. Aroma of vinegar, oak, tart but overripe dark fruits, malts and light vinous notes. Flavour is moderate sweet and sour. Above medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle shared at deanso¬ís. Pours a mahogony with an off white head. Vinegary, dark cherries, wine, red fruits, caramel, sweet malts. Very vineous. Medium sweet, medium sour. Medium body, medium carbonation.

33cl bottle shared with Kermis and 2 others.
Thin ring off white head. Clear almost black pour. Some vinegar

White label bottle: 18/02/2016. Mahogany Red color with a small beige head that faints quickly but it¬ís a natural cause of all the barrel aging in this beer. Complex aromas of red wine, cherries, dark fruits and some vinegar. Medium carbonation, and tart acidity in the mouthfeel.Very complex in taste but artistically balanced. You can definitely see some Pannepot Reserva in it (never had the Earthmonk). A very unique beer that is way ahead of the typical Flemish Sour genre for sure.World Class for me.
Bottle - pours dirty brown tan head - nose and taste of caramel, red fruits, wine, sour oaky funk - medium body

Awesome. Balanced berry like sourness with overripe fruit sweetness, dried fruits, oak impact, cherries, vanilla, smooth maltiness, caramel. Moderate to light sweetness, with moderate tartness.
Perfect balance, highly enjoyable
Bottle from Etre gourmet. amber, dark brown color. Port wine, bourbon, vanilla, sherry, fudge, prune. very very dry. complex stuff.

Bottle (v2009) courtesy of skullgeorge. Dark brown color with beige brown head. Malty aroma, some caramel, dark dried fruits, light tart fruity. Taste is different than what you expect from aroma. Light sweet and heavy acidic, vinegar, tart fruity again, smoked notes, wood. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Bottled:Pours deep redish brown with a small head.Sweet aroma with notes of fudge, cherries and some licorice. Thick and round mouth feel.Sweet and sour aroma of raspberries, currants and cherries leading to a warming finish.Really good!

Pours a deep brownish red with a small beige ring of foam. The nose has almonds and kirsch, raisin chocolate and a slight roast in the end. Sour kirsch and vinegar taste with some pannpot notes of deep old ale. A dry bretty aftertaste and a mineral finish.. great stuff

Really dark brown color with tan head. Aroma has dark malts and dark fruits but with some kind of tart freshness. Taste, indeed, starts tart with dark fruit notes and some balsamic vinegar but finishes with some roasted malts. Not very acidic, dry and sour but easy to drink. Medium to full bodied with medium carbonation. Really similar to Aardmonnik, just a bit more harsh and not so well balanced and mellow.
Bottle shared. Dark pour with a nice tan head. Notes of cherries, red wine, apple vinegar, grape vinegar, cocoa, chocolate, spices. Medium to full body, medium carbonation.

Bottle at home. Very dark brown with a small beige head. Medium to full body with low to moderate carbonation. Well balanced sour, sweet and bitter tones. Vanilla, oak, tart, grapes and caramel. Nice!

Bottle at home. Looks really good. Small label with all important information. Beer in the glass deep black, small head. Fine malty-sourish aroma. Starts intense malty, roasty, notes of plum, some nuts. Earthy notes. More and more sourish hints, cherries, not too intense. Finish less sourish, malty-stouty notes. Well balanced. Quite drinkable. Love that combination of sour and stouty notes. Really good!

Bottled. Pours deep brown with an average beige head. Aroma of sour berries, earth, vinegar, grapes, wood, caramel and bready notes. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up being dry and tart. Medium bodied, watery to oily texture. An excellent Sout. üåüüåüüåüüåü

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2016 Shared at Hopishop 2016, courtesy of 77ships, thanks! Aroma of sweet syrup, caramel, red fruit, vinous tart, oak and vanilla. Taste has vinous red fruit, oak, soft tart, lacto sourness and some nice caramel. Very nice.

thnx to Urbain ! pours very dark, small white head. Smell is wine, bit oak, mildly sour. Taste is Sharp, accidic sourness, dry, Def a lot of the earthmonk. Tastes aged in a way. Very happy to finally have tried this !

Thank you for sharing. Happy to actually try this one. 330 ml. bottle sampled. 2009 Vintage. Bottled 18.02.2016. Barrel Aged for 7 (yeah!) years. Black with little tanned head. Nose is big oxidation with Aardmonnik turned to vinegar, sour cherry & dark fruit oxidized Pannepot. Taste is big on oxidation, old Pannepot, oxidized, thin, old wood, decent vinegar, sour cherry, bit empty due to age, thinned dark fruits. Body is mainly oxidized Pannepot some vinegar. Overall nice to try it but 7 years in the barrel was clearly far too long & they just released it now, it has been years since I understood what Struise is doing.

33cl bottle @ Strusie Schooltje, thanks Urbain for cracking this brand new batch.
De couleur ambr√©e versant sur le cuivre, le col est moyen oscillant entre moka et caf√© au lait et l√©ger beige.
Ar√¥me pr√©sente un bouquet qui de suite annonce des effluves anglaises avec un Thomas Hardy¬ís qui n¬íest pas en reste et fort complexe malgr√© son faible ajout par barrique. Retrouve un nez malt√©, grill√©, un peu crystal, l√©ger toffee, fruit√© noir avec un c√¥t√© de prune et date. Le tout est finement aigrelet tout en mod√©ration.
Palais est plus ax√© sur le suret, c√¥t√© de baies rouges avec un petit c√¥t√© de cassis voire de groseille. Retrouve une certaine s√©cheresse anglaise au niveau malt√© tout en ayant une base de d√©part clairement plus Struise. Fort √† pens√© que la Pannepot a aussi √©volu√©e depuis 2007 au niveau de sa finesse. Fini l√©g√®rement bois√© avec un fruit√© noir qui passe un peu au dessus du noir. Le fini garde aussi un l√©ger profil et caract√®re suret, funk avec un superbe fini grill√© apportant une pointe de chaleur. A revisiter pour voir l¬í√©volution du caract√®re suret qui a des chances de pouvoir accentuer le profil aigrelet.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2014 Once made in a limited volume of only 5 hl, exclusively for beer festivals and only on tap; I encountered it twice, the first time at the ZBF of 2007 and then at the HOP Karakterbierweekend in Vichte in June 2007; this rating is based on the second encounter. Tanned, thin, loosely structured and quickly dissolving head, colour mahogany - bronze; aroma stunningly complex, very fruity and earthy, maltiness with elegant sour notes, impressions of oak, dates, bitter chocolate, port wine, raisins, balsamic vinegar, medium dry sherry, dried leaves, coffee grounds, hazelnuts, passion fruit; taste equally complex, in fact one of the most complex ales I ever had the pleasure to taste, exotic fruit, deep and rich, multi-layered maltiness, a bit toasty, chocolatey, nutty, all drenched in a refreshing lactic acidity which is blended in perfectly, ending in a fascinatingly complex, long and dry aftertaste. An absolute delight, a pity it is not produced anymore; blending two masterpieces does not necessarily result in a new masterpiece, but in this case each of the two components brilliantly reinforce one another.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2014 ZBF2007: Saurer Kirschgeruch. S√§uerlicher Antrunk, leicht alkoholischer Mittelteil. Das Bier schwankt immer wieder zwischen eiem s√§uerlichen und einem eher s√º√ülichen Kirscharoma. So auch im kirschig-malzigen Nachgeschmack, in dem der Hopfen kratzig erscheint.
UPDATED: FEB 17, 2008 ZBF 2007:  Hazy brown colored pour with medium sized head.  Fruity, acidic nose with a spicy, earth toned, dry finish.

Tasted at the ZBF. This one was the one that caused me to stop moving around and set up camp at the Stuise booth. It will stop you in your tracks as well. A wonderful blend of wood aged vinious beauty. Only problem is that I can¬ít get any more till next voyage to Belgium. Enjoy fellas! We¬íll get our hands on some somehow ; -)

Tasted at the Struise Farm next to Aardmonnik. Aardnon was On tap. Lighter in color than Aardmonnik and this one did had the most beautiful foam.Aroma is Soft and less vinegar like than its brother. Nice woodyness, very good balance and highly drinkable. Taste is malty, winelike, Pannepot reserva caracter, bready and smooth peppercake. Great balans and clear afthertaste.

Second taste (first at ZBF) Now on tap @ KBW. Hazy dark brown, light beige head. Aroma sour, fruits, dark malts, little candi. Medium to full body. Taste is complex but good: malts, sourness, little sweet, nuts ?.

A splendid beer. I could taste almost every beer on draft they ad at the beerfestival. Very nice brewerie. Only a problem with the Kloeke Blond. Splendid beers with very nice and complex taste. A lust for every beer taster

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2007 On draught @ Struise farm. Chesnut coloured beer with great beige creamy head. Aroma is malty and slight sharp with hints of earth, candi, dead leafs and old port wine. The smell is simply magificent. Taste is very Trappist like, it is soft, velvety and complex. Hints of sweet chesnuts, tart red fruits, caramel, bread, malts, some vinous accents and touches of port. Afthertaste is rich, very complex yet refreshing at the same time. Thanks Urbain for this fine treat. I drank a 75cl bottle today that I¬íve got from Urbain the other day and this beer is evolving greatly!

Brown reddish body, huge beige head, thick lacing; Huge great nose, with lots of complexity, tons of different elements from fresh sour fruits to warmer malty licorice; Near perfect carbonation in a body that is a very little soft, bitter, sour and sweet; Loooong finish where the sourness grows and the aromas explode. Very, very great beer!

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2009 Draft at ZBF 2007: Just found my notes (almost two months later). A beer I will never forget! Ruddy dark brown with red highlights under a thick, tight tan head. Aroma had a nice balance of acid, malt, and earth with vinous notes (as if I were drinking it in a the barrel ageing cellar of ancient wine-maker). Taste.... superb! This has to be one of the most well balanced beers I have ever tasted. Everything working in harmony... Dark red fruits, creme di balsamico, malt, roast, sugar, toffee, and dare I say... a slight hint of sourdough bread in the finish? Mouthfeel was just perfect for this beer. It seemed to want to punish you by slapping you around, yet it seemed to hit in a more teasing way, leaving you to want more "abuse." One of the best beers I have had in a very long time.

Red to brown beer with a big and creamy white to beige foam. Nose is elegant malty and earthy with hints of sour fruits and berries. Taste is less full than the Aardmonnik version and the mouth feeling is elegant and refreshing. The taste has hints of old wine, wood, nuts, earth, Porto, dry fruits, horse sweat and old wood. Taste on tap at Zythos 2007. Very similar with the Aardmonnik version but more refined and a bit less powerful. A unique beer !

Draught at ZBF 2007, Sint-Niklaas, Belgium. Very dark body.  Lightly brown, creamy head. Fruity aroma of apples and wine.  Lightlu sweet, moderately sour flavour.  Very well balanced and complex.  Keep up the good work guys!

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2007 Draught. Dark brown red coloured. Dense light brown head. Aroma is great. Berries, subtle sourness, spice, grape, some earthnotes and a countering sweetness gives a aroma in great balance. Flavour as well i harmonious and balanced. Dense sour berries, flowers, light sour grape, spice and some light vinegarnotes. Very complex. Has a fantastic mouthfeel. Is dry and grapish in the end with some berrysweetness. Yet another masterpiece from the fantastic Struise brewers. Cheers to Urbain, Carlo and all the others.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2007 A Mes rate:
Draught at ZBF. Totally love Aardmonnik, totally love Pannepot. Of course they go together, no brainer really. Like a tarty Pannepot or a less sour Aardmonnik. Sweet and sour caramel nose. Red grapes (red wine) a la Aarmonnik. Great dark brown colour with a tan head. Simply incredible in the mouth dancing over the palate jumping from sour Aardmonnik character to the candy sugared roastyness of Pannepot. Earthy and sugary, balsamic (very) and creamy. Its a tastebud assault. Loooong finish goes on for a long time. Superb. Clearly one of the best of the festival.

The Earth Nun has arrived. Dark brown, thick head. Aroma of sour apples and other sour fruits. Lively, slighty acidic mouthfeel, tart-sour fruit flavor, maybe cherries. Lacks the creaminess and maltiness of the Reserva, but still dry and lovely.
UPDATED: MAY 11, 2007 Draught: Poured a dark hazy brown with light brown thick fast acting head. The aroma was fruit and acidic. Spicy earthy flavor that finshed dry acidy.

Dull chestnut colour; good beige head. Sour, lactic and even acetic acid aromas, severe. Very dry, extremely woody with a perfect lactic/acetic balance. Complex without showing. Very dry, agreable, certain slickness. Great beer, but oh, so severe!
